content: I am following the instructions given in the
https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-env-first-time-contributors.html#step-3-start-the-dev-environment
I have started the development environment
So after I start the server the ending should look like :

webpack: bundle is now VALID.
2016-05-06 21:43:29,553 INFO Tornado 31.6% busy over the past 10.6 seconds
2016-05-06 21:43:35,007 INFO Tornado 23.9% busy over the past 16.0 seconds
according to the document
By I do not see that
can anybody help me with this?
@Aswin kumar What message do you see instead?
These are the last 4 lines :

2016-11-04 20:45:18,863 INFO Received event: {u'timestamp': 1478306712.737282, u'user_profile_id': 3, u'message_id': 100}
2016-11-04 20:50:12,514 INFO Tornado removed 0 idle event queues owned by 0 users in 0.000s. Now 0 active queues, 0 handlers, latest ID 0
2016-11-04 20:55:12,511 INFO Tornado removed 0 idle event queues owned by 0 users in 0.000s. Now 0 active queues, 0 handlers, latest ID 0
2016-11-04 21:00:12,517 INFO Tornado removed 0 idle event queues owned by 0 users in 0.000s. Now 0 active queues, 0 handlers, latest ID 0
@Sumana Harihareswara
@Aswin kumar Looks like we ought to update the documentation on that (am pinging @Christie Koehler who ought to have a look) . I believe you're fine.

Go ahead and follow the directions in https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-env-first-time-contributors.html#step-3-start-the-dev-environment to visit your development environment in your browser.
Yeah I have visited the development environment in the browser using the link
http://localhost:9991/
Great! Then things are working out well.
How do I login into the dev environment in the browser?
@Aswin kumar Do you see buttons, in the web page, offering you the ability to log in as various users?
Do you see something like https://raw.githubusercontent.com/zulip/zulip/master/docs/images/zulip-dev.png ?
Yeah I do see that
OK. @Aswin kumar Do you remember the blog post I pointed you to, the blog post I wrote about the scientific method?
Yeah , I will have to check that out again
Yeah @Sumana Harihareswara . got it trail and error
@Aswin kumar I'm not sure I understand you. Are you saying that you're now logged in?
@Sumana Harihareswara There are many users. I had clicked on cordelia@zulip.com I am now logged in
Great. :)
So if I make any changes in the code , it gets reflected here on my browser?

The development environment gives you the ability to log in as a realm administrator, or as one of several users. The test data that comes preloaded in the environment lets you see, for instance, different people's private messages.
I am not sure whether the server automatically restarts when it detects that one of the Zulip server code files has changed. Try it and see!
@Sumana Harihareswara I have question regarding the development. When you make changes in the code, how do you check whether the functionality works fine?
@Sumana Harihareswara
Hi @Aswin kumar . After you make changes to your code, you can follow this - https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/using-dev-environment.html.
@Reyha Verma Thank you, I will check that out
